item.title: What Trump's fight with Powell could mean for the Fed's future
item.description: President Trump has been trying to bully the Federal Reserve into cutting interest rates. It's a gambit that could lead to more inflation.
item.content:encoded: President Trump has been trying to bully the Federal Reserve into cutting interest rates. It's a gambit that could lead to more inflation.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: Inflation steadies but it's still higher than many would like
item.description: Inflation didn't get worse in December. But it didn't get better. Prices were up 2.7% a year ago. A drop in gasoline prices was more than offset by rising grocery and electricity bills.

item.title: What to know about Trump's ugly feud with the Federal Reserve
item.description: A Justice Department probe of the Federal Reserve marks the latest escalation in the Trump administration's effort to bend the independent central bank to the president's will.

item.title: DOJ subpoenas the Federal Reserve in an escalating pressure campaign
item.description: The Justice Department has subpoenaed the Fed over Chair Jerome Powell's testimony over the central bank's headquarters renovation. Powell calls it part of a pressure campaign over interest rates.

item.title: How are U.S. oil companies responding to Trump's plans for Venezuela?
item.description: President Trump met with oil executives on Friday. Trump wants major investments in Venezuela. He announced a near-term plan to control Venezuelan oil sales.

item.title: Hiring slows in December to end the weakest year of job growth since the pandemic
item.description: U.S. employers added 50,000 jobs in December, according to a report from the Labor Department Friday. Measured annually, job gains in 2025 were the slowest since 2020.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: U.S. population growth is slowing. The immigration crackdown is a major factor
item.description: Congressional forecasters have lowered their projection for U.S. population growth over the next decade by 7 million people as a result of the Trump administration's immigration crackdown as well as falling birth rates.
